detectors.description:
Lotto () contract sets array length with a user-controlled value:
	- playersList.push(msg.sender) ()
detectors.markdown:
[Lotto]() contract sets array length with a user-controlled value:
	- [playersList.push(msg.sender)]()

detectors.description: Lotto._pickWinner() () uses a weak PRNG: "random = (uint256(sha256()(block.blockhash(block.number - 1),block.coinbase,block.difficulty,block.gaslimit,block.number,block.timestamp,msg.data,msg.gas,msg.sender,msg.sig,msg.value)) % jackpot) + 1 ()"

Lotto._pickWinner() () uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- random <= playersAmounts[playersList[playerNumber]] ()
detectors.markdown:
[Lotto._pickWinner()]() uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- [random <= playersAmounts[playersList[playerNumber]]]()

detectors.description:
Deprecated standard detected random = (uint256(sha256()(block.blockhash(block.number - 1),block.coinbase,block.difficulty,block.gaslimit,block.number,block.timestamp,msg.data,msg.gas,msg.sender,msg.sig,msg.value)) % jackpot) + 1 ():
	- Usage of "block.blockhash()" should be replaced with "blockhash()"
	- Usage of "msg.gas" should be replaced with "gasleft()"
detectors.markdown:
Deprecated standard detected [random = (uint256(sha256()(block.blockhash(block.number - 1),block.coinbase,block.difficulty,block.gaslimit,block.number,block.timestamp,msg.data,msg.gas,msg.sender,msg.sig,msg.value)) % jackpot) + 1]():
	- Usage of "block.blockhash()" should be replaced with "blockhash()"
	- Usage of "msg.gas" should be replaced with "gasleft()"

detectors.description:
Deprecated standard detected THROW ():
	- Usage of "throw" should be replaced with "revert()"
detectors.markdown:
Deprecated standard detected [THROW]():
	- Usage of "throw" should be replaced with "revert()"

detectors.description: solc-0.4.0 is not recommended for deployment
detectors.markdown: solc-0.4.0 is not recommended for deployment

detectors.description: Event Lotto.newGame(uint256,uint256) () is not in CapWords
Function Lotto._admin(uint256,uint256) () is not in mixedCase
Event Lotto.forceGame(uint256,uint256) () is not in CapWords
Function Lotto._withdraw(address,uint256) () is not in mixedCase

Reentrancy in Lotto._withdraw(address,uint256) ():
	External calls:
	- destination.send(value) ()
	Event emitted after the call(s):
	- payment(block.timestamp,destination,value,true) ()
detectors.markdown:
Reentrancy in [Lotto._withdraw(address,uint256)]():
	External calls:
	- [destination.send(value)]()
	Event emitted after the call(s):
	- [payment(block.timestamp,destination,value,true)]()

detectors.description:
Reentrancy in Lotto._pickWinner() ():
	External calls:
	- playersList[playerNumber].send(jackpot) ()
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- feesPerMillion = nextFeesPerMillion ()
	- gameNumber = gameNumber + 1 ()
	- jackpot = 0 ()
	- maxPlay = nextMaxPlay ()
	- minPlay = nextMinPlay ()
	- playersAmounts[playersList[i]] = 0 ()
	- delete playersList ()
	- target = nextTarget ()
	Event emitted after the call(s):
	- payment(block.timestamp,playersList[playerNumber],jackpot,true) ()
detectors.markdown:
Reentrancy in [Lotto._pickWinner()]():
	External calls:
	- [playersList[playerNumber].send(jackpot)]()
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- [feesPerMillion = nextFeesPerMillion]()
	- [gameNumber = gameNumber + 1]()
	- [jackpot = 0]()
	- [maxPlay = nextMaxPlay]()
	- [minPlay = nextMinPlay]()
	- [playersAmounts[playersList[i]] = 0]()
	- [delete playersList]()
	- [target = nextTarget]()
	Event emitted after the call(s):
	- [payment(block.timestamp,playersList[playerNumber],jackpot,true)]()

detectors.description:
Lotto.Lotto() () uses literals with too many digits:
	- vMillion = 1000000 ()
detectors.markdown:
[Lotto.Lotto()]() uses literals with too many digits:
	- [vMillion = 1000000]()

detectors.description: Loop condition i < playersList.length () should use cached array length instead of referencing `length` member of the storage array.
detectors.markdown: Loop condition [i < playersList.length]() should use cached array length instead of referencing `length` member of the storage array.
